stance_1: I am flexible with my meat-eating
stance_2: I am not pressured by others' eating habits
justification: The interviewee explicitly states that their flexibility comes from not feeling pressured by others.

stance_1: I am flexible with my meat-eating
justification: Flexibility is directly tied to the practice of eating meat in moderation, as described in the transcript.

stance_1: I am flexible with my meat-eating
stance_2: I choose plant-based meals for variety
justification: Flexibility is demonstrated by the willingness to sometimes choose plant-based meals for variety.

stance_1: I am flexible with my meat-eating
stance_2: People around me have different meat-eating habits
justification: The interviewee says that seeing different habits around them supports their own flexibility.

stance_1: I eat meat because it is familiar
justification: The interviewee lists both familiarity and convenience as primary reasons for eating meat in the same sentence.

stance_2: I choose plant-based meals for variety
justification: Moderation in meat-eating is supported by sometimes choosing plant-based meals for variety.
Eating meat in moderation is partly due to choosing meat when it is convenient, contributing to a balanced intake.

stance_2: I eat meat because it is familiar
justification: Familiarity with meat is one reason why it remains part of the diet, even as intake is moderated.

justification: Awareness of others’ habits encourages moderation and reflection, as mentioned by the interviewee.
